interestingcomments.content:
For my next project, I am retrofitting a PumpZero compressor on a $20 harbor freight 4gal backpack sprayer /!/ [Here are the materials](https://i.imgur.com/SGDz23R.png)

I picked up the harbor freight 4 gal backpack sprayer for $20 and pretty much everything about it looks cheap. My plan is to 3d print an adapter for the fill cover that the pumpzero compressor will thread in to. 

I am also retrofitting the fieldking wand which will require a 3d printed coupler. That will allow me to use the TeeJet spray nozzles that i just purchased. 

From what i can tell, it appears both the filler cap and the compressor have non-standard 45 deg sawtooth threads. After a few hours of measuring, designing and 3 test prints [I've figured out the filler cap threads](https://i.imgur.com/iIUjmaZ.png). 

Since the angle of the threads is opposite from the filler cap to the compressor i'm going to print two separate parts and glue them together. A test print for the thread pitch on the compressor is printing now. 

I'll make sure to post an update in a few days with progress.
